name: Cenote
headline: Automate back office tasks for medical clinics
description:
Cenote uses AI to automate the back office for medical practices — eliminating the bottlenecks that often delay patient care and clinic revenue.

Typically, practices hire teams to manually extract patient info from hundreds to thousands of faxes a week. This slow process risks losing patients to faster competitors. Cenote’s software streamlines this workflow. 

Between the 50 million specialist outpatient visits and 40 million specialty drug prescriptions annually, Cenote accelerates access to a $90 billion market.

The team behind Cenote—Kofi, Ajani, and Kristy—met in San Francisco and bring deep expertise in building scalable solutions for highly-regulated industries such as climate and gov tech.
tags: industry:robotic-process-automation; industry:health-tech; industry:b2b; industry:healthcare; industry:ai; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Kofi Ansong, Founder
founders.description:
I am the co-founder and CEO of Cenote. I graduated with a degree in computer science and worked for three years at Promise, a YC company in the gov-tech industry, so I have experience building in heavily regulated industries. 
Outside of work, you’ll often find me on a run or perfecting my refried bean paste recipe. :)

founders.name: Kristy Gao, Founder
founders.description: Hi! I'm the CTO of Cenote. I studied Computer Science at UWaterloo. Before YC I was a software engineer at Watershed, a carbon accounting startup. I've also worked at huge companies like Google and PayPal and also teeny tiny startups. When I'm not working I'm running, surfing, painting, roller blading, and trying to balance my 1001 different hobbies.

founders.name: Ajani Smith-Washington, Founder
founders.description: Before Cenote he spent the last 3 years as an early stage VC at Base10, investing $30M in seed and series A stage companies. Ajani graduated from Howard University with degrees in Physics and Economics.

generated_description:
**Cenote Overview: A Game Changer for Medical Practices**

Cenote is a fresh name in the health-tech landscape, founded in 2024 and incubated in Y Combinator’s Batch W25. Its mission is simple but powerful: automate back-office tasks for medical clinics, cutting out inefficiencies that slow down patient care and revenue. This is crucial because, in today’s fast-paced healthcare environment, every minute counts. 

**Problem Solving with AI**

Traditionally, medical practices have been bogged down by manual processes, like sifting through hundreds or even thousands of faxes each week to extract patient information. This tedious work not only hampers productivity but also endangers patient retention. Cenote uses advanced AI technology to streamline these workflows, allowing clinics to respond faster and more accurately to patient needs. 

Imagine this: there are about 50 million specialist outpatient visits and 40 million specialty drug prescriptions each year in the U.S. Cenote is uniquely positioned to tap into this massive $90 billion market by eliminating the bottlenecks that slow practices down. 

**Meet the Team**

The founders—Kofi, Ajani, and Kristy—bring a robust background to the table. Meeting in San Francisco, they’ve previously honed their skills in building scalable solutions for highly regulated industries like climate tech and government services. Their combined expertise lends itself well to the intricacies of healthcare.

**What Cenote Offers**

With a compact team operating out of the San Francisco Bay Area, Cenote’s offerings include:

1. **Fax and Document Triage**: Automatic routing of incoming documents to eliminate chaos.
2. **Gap Detection and Denial Reduction**: Advanced AI identifies missing or incomplete patient data before claims are denied, saving clinics from prolonged payment delays.
3. **Data Extraction and Storage**: Automating data entry into Electronic Health Records (EHRs) reduces errors and repetitive tasks, freeing up staff for more essential patient-facing work.
4. **AI Callers**: A fleet of AI callers handles authorizations, ensuring clinics never fall behind in their insurance processes.

Cenote is not just about automation; it’s about transforming the way medical practices operate, allowing healthcare providers to focus on what truly matters: patient care.

**Community Engagement and Growth**

Looking ahead, Cenote is actively engaging with the medical community. They’ll be present at MedTrade (booth 1656) and are hosting meetups for DMEs and sleep professionals, illustrating their commitment to building relationships and sharing insights.

If you're intrigued by the idea of working smarter—not harder—in your medical practice, Cenote offers demos that you can book right on their [website](https://www.joincenote.com/).

**Final Thoughts**

Cenote embodies a vital evolution in healthcare technology. By marrying AI with an understanding of clinical workflows, they not only improve efficiency but also enhance the patient experience. In a landscape hungry for innovation, Cenote is a name worth watching. 

For any inquiries, you can reach out via founders@joincenote.com or learn more about their solutions on their [website](https://www.joincenote.com/).
